parameters.label: Total Cholesterol
parameters.notes: Desirable: <200 mg/dL. 200–239 borderline high; ≥240 high.

parameters.label: HDL Cholesterol
parameters.notes: Protective cholesterol. Men: desirable >40 mg/dL; Women: desirable >50 mg/dL. Higher is better.

parameters.label: LDL Cholesterol
parameters.notes: Optimal LDL: <100 mg/dL. 100–129 near optimal; >160 high.

parameters.label: VLDL Cholesterol
parameters.notes: Typical VLDL: 2–30 mg/dL; elevated with high triglycerides.

parameters.label: Triglycerides
parameters.notes: Normal: <150 mg/dL. 150–199 borderline; 200–499 high.

parameters.label: Cholesterol/HDL Ratio
parameters.notes: Desirable ratio: <4.5 (lower indicates lower risk).

parameters.label: Vitamin D (25(OH)D)
parameters.notes: Sufficient: 20–50 ng/mL. Deficiency <20 ng/mL; Insufficiency 20–29 ng/mL; Toxicity >100 ng/mL.

parameters.label: Serum Iron
parameters.notes: Normal serum iron: 60–170 µg/dL; low suggests iron deficiency.

parameters.label: Total Iron Binding Capacity (TIBC)
parameters.notes: TIBC typically 240–450 µg/dL; high TIBC suggests iron deficiency.

parameters.label: Transferrin Saturation
parameters.notes: Transferrin saturation 20–50% (low in iron deficiency).

parameters.label: Serum Ferritin
parameters.notes: Ferritin reflects iron stores: Men 24–336 ng/mL, Women 11–307 ng/mL; low ferritin indicates iron deficiency.

parameters.label: Serum Creatinine
parameters.notes: Creatinine normal ranges differ by sex; elevated values suggest reduced kidney function.

parameters.label: Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN)
parameters.notes: BUN normal: 7–20 mg/dL; high BUN can indicate renal impairment or dehydration.

parameters.label: Uric Acid
parameters.notes: Uric acid normal ranges differ by sex; very high values associated with gout or renal disease.

parameters.label: Sodium (Na+)
parameters.notes: Normal sodium: 135–145 mmol/L; abnormalities affect fluid balance and neurologic status.

parameters.label: Potassium (K+)
parameters.notes: Normal potassium: 3.5–5.0 mmol/L; hypo/hyperkalemia can be dangerous.

parameters.label: Chloride (Cl-)
parameters.notes: Chloride: 98–107 mmol/L; changes often mirror sodium and acid-base status.

parameters.label: Calcium
parameters.notes: Serum calcium normal: 8.5–10.5 mg/dL; interpret with albumin if abnormal.

parameters.label: eGFR
parameters.notes: eGFR >90 mL/min/1.73m² is normal; lower values indicate reduced kidney function/staging.

parameters.label: Total Bilirubin
parameters.notes: Total bilirubin normal: 0.1–1.2 mg/dL; elevated levels cause jaundice.

parameters.label: Direct Bilirubin
parameters.notes: Direct bilirubin (conjugated) normally 0.0–0.3 mg/dL; elevation suggests obstructive or hepatic causes.

parameters.label: SGPT (ALT)
parameters.notes: ALT (SGPT) normal 7–56 U/L; elevated in hepatocellular injury.

parameters.label: SGOT (AST)
parameters.notes: AST (SGOT) normal 8–48 U/L; interpret AST/ALT ratio for differential diagnosis.

parameters.label: Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP)
parameters.notes: ALP normal 44–147 U/L; high in cholestasis or bone disease.

parameters.label: Total Protein
parameters.notes: Total protein normal 6.0–8.3 g/dL; low levels seen in malnutrition or liver disease.

parameters.label: Albumin
parameters.notes: Albumin normal 3.5–5.0 g/dL; low albumin suggests chronic liver disease or malnutrition.

parameters.label: Total T3
parameters.notes: Total T3 normal 80–200 ng/dL.

parameters.label: Total T4
parameters.notes: Total T4 normal 5.0–12.0 µg/dL.

parameters.label: TSH
parameters.notes: TSH normal 0.4–4.0 µIU/mL; low TSH suggests hyperthyroidism, high suggests hypothyroidism.

parameters.label: Hemoglobin
parameters.notes: Hemoglobin normal: Men 13.8–17.2 g/dL; Women 12.1–15.1 g/dL.

parameters.label: RBC Count
parameters.notes: RBC count normal: Men 4.7–6.1; Women 4.2–5.4 million/µL.

parameters.label: Hematocrit
parameters.notes: Hematocrit normal ranges: Men 40–52%; Women 36–48%.

parameters.label: WBC Count
parameters.notes: WBC normal: 4,000–11,000/µL; elevated in infection/inflammation.

parameters.label: Platelet Count
parameters.notes: Platelet count normal: 150,000–450,000/µL.

parameters.label: Color
parameters.notes: Expected: Pale yellow. Dark urine may indicate dehydration or bilirubin.

parameters.label: Appearance
parameters.notes: Expected: Clear. Cloudy urine may indicate infection or crystals.

parameters.label: Specific Gravity
parameters.notes: Specific gravity 1.005–1.030; indicates urine concentration.

parameters.label: pH
parameters.notes: Urine pH 4.6–8.0; abnormal values suggest metabolic or renal issues.

parameters.label: Fasting Blood Glucose
parameters.notes: Fasting blood glucose normal 70–100 mg/dL.

parameters.label: Postprandial Glucose (2hr)
parameters.notes: Postprandial (2hr) desirable <140 mg/dL.

parameters.label: Random Glucose
parameters.notes: Random glucose <200 mg/dL generally acceptable; higher values suggest hyperglycemia.

parameters.label: HbA1c
parameters.notes: HbA1c: normal 4.0–5.6%; Prediabetes 5.7–6.4%; Diabetes ≥6.5%.

healthpkg.notes: Composite panel - includes CBC, KFT, LFT, Lipid, Thyroid, Urine, Diabetes, Vitamin D, Iron. Use UI to render each sub-panel.
